choices: The old celebrity standby... irreconcilable differences!
You just can't deal with her drama anymore!
1.content: You've been together with your girlfriend almost a year. Deciding that it would be better for the two of you to part ways, you plan to break the news to her. But first, you need to know what your reason for breaking up. So what was the final straw?
1.title: The Reason

choices: Confess everything and hope she understands.
Break up without mentioning your extracurricular activities.
11.content:
Yep, that's right. You've been seeing someone behind your girlfriend's back. Maybe it was a one night stand, or maybe it's been a drawn-out affair. Regardless, you just can't take all the sneaking around anymore! The guilt is killing you, and you'd rather just be with your new lady anyway!

You distinctly remember your girlfriend's words to you when the two of you first started dating:

"If you ever cheat on me, I'll make you pay."

With those words echoing in your head, how do you break the news to her?
11.title: You cheated on her!

111.content:
Even with her warning in your head, you still figure honesty is the best policy and break the news to her. You explain that you met somebody else, and that you accidentally slept together... eight times.

After a long night of crying and talking, it finally seems like you've said all you can say. You stand up to give her a hug and she rises to meet you. Only, instead of hugging you, she knees you right in the bread basket.

As you're curled up in a fetal position on the floor, she storms out, then thinks twice and comes back, ripping your precious XBOX 360 out of the entertainment center and hurling it out the window.

"I don't ever want to see you again," she snaps.

She storms out of the apartment, slamming the door behind her and leaving you on the ground, cradling your injury.
111.title: Confess everything and hope she understands.

choices: "Remember when I told you there wasn't anybody else?  Well..."
112.content:
You end things with your girlfriend without making mention of your infidelities. You give her the "it's not you, it's me" speech, and tell her that you think it would be better if the two of you were just friends for awhile.

She asks if there's anyone else, which you of course deny.

It's a rough night, but eventually you part ways. Sighing with relief, you're now free to see your other lady friend without worrying about sneaking around or being too discreet.


A week later, you and your new fling are getting hot and heavy on the couch when the key turns in the lock and your ex-girlfriend walks in and sees the two of you. She drops the box she was carrying and takes in the situation. Less than a week later, her ex-boyfriend already has some new girl's top halfway off in his living room.

Your ex-girlfriend's eyes narrow.
112.title: Break up without mentioning your extracurricula...

1121.content:
"Listen, baby. I can explain..." You start.

"Don't bother," she snaps back at you. "I just came to get that last of my things."

You and your new girlfriend sit awkwardly on the couch while your ex-girlfriend tosses some things in the box, then disappears into the bedroom to finish up. When she's finished, she heads right for the door, without looking at you.

"Have a nice life," she mutters, then disappears.


The next morning, you go out to your car, only to realize the tires have been slashed and your doors keyed. "Asshole" and other colorful expletives have been spray painted onto your windshield and windows.

Nice job, Cassanova.
1121.title: "Listen, baby.  I can explain..."

1122.content:
"So yeah, remember when I said there wasn't anyone else? Well..."

Your ex-girlfriend rolls her eyes.

"I don't want to hear it. I just came to get a few things."

You and your new girl sit awkwardly on the couch while your girlfriend rummages around through cabinets and drawers and closets, tossing stuff into the box. When she's finished, she leaves without saying another word.

Thinking nothing more of it, you go on with your evening.

Until a loud knock at the door disturbs you once again.

"Police! Open Up!"

Confused, you make your way over to the door, just as the police ram the door, busting it open and off its hinges. Your new girl screams as they grab you and throw you to the ground, cuffing your hands behind your back.

"Looks like we got here just in time," one of the officers said to another.

"What are you talking about?" You ask, scared out of your mind.

"Got an anonymous tip that you were trying to seduce a minor. You're going to jail, perv."

"She's twenty! I swear!"

"That's what they all say," the officer remarks, hauling you off to the squad car.

Rather than spending the night in bed with your twenty-year-old lady friend, you're treated to a night in a dingy police interrogation room with two large, sweaty cops.
1122.title: "Remember when I told you there wasn't ...

choices: It's the high ground for me!
12.content:
Well, you're fairly certain that your girlfriend has been cheating on you. I mean, there's always a chance it's all a big misunderstanding... but considering you're watching them frolick around in the hot tub of the motel you followed her to, you're fairly certain that the odds are on your side.

The only thing left to do now is decide how you want to handle this.
12.title: She cheated on you!

121.content:
You decide that, out of respect for her, and the love you once shared, you would simply break things off and go your separate ways. You head back to her place, gather your few belongings, and leave her an explanatory note telling her that it's over.

(Let's face it... while honorable, there's not much humor in taking the high road!)
121.title: It's the high ground for me!

122.content:
You immediately throw all sense of decency and compassion out the window. You're going to make her pay for doing this to you! As you watch things start to heat up in the hot tub, you try and think of what you could do to get back at her.

Looking around the car for inspiration, you find...
122.title: Low road, all the way!

1221.content:
Using the camera she bought you for your birthday last year, you slip out of the car and approach the pool area from the other side of the gate. The place is empty now, except for the two lovers in the hot tub.

Resisting the urge to yell or say anything, you instead focus on the artistic integrity of the shots:


- As she removes her bikini top and starts making out with him, topless.

- As her head disappears under the water and he leans his back in ecstasy.

- As she writhes against him, naked in the bubbly water.


In the course of taking the photos, you're reminded of what a great body your girlfriend has... and that in addition to posting them in her family's online photo album, you also might be able to make some money with them.

You smile as you return to the car, camera full of incriminating photos.
1221.title: Your camera

1222.content:
Picking up your cell phone, you dial the number of the motel and ask to speak with the manager. You play the part of a concerned guest, worried that the couple having sex out by the pool are in full view of the other guests and children staying there.

You sit back and watch with glee as security arrives and escorts the couple, mid-coitus, into a waiting police car.
1222.title: Your cell phone

13.content:
Well, there's not really much that can be said. You sit your girlfriend down and tell her that you just don't think it's working out anymore. You feel like you've been growing apart lately, and then chemistry that you used to have just isn't there anymore.

Your girlfriend sighs with relief.

She confesses that she's been feeling the same way too, and now that you've said something, she's finally free to embrace who she really is.

On her way out the door, you overhear her calling up a girlfriend and telling her excitedly that they don't have to sneak around anymore... they can finally be together.
13.title: The old celebrity standby... irreconcilable dif...

14.content:
You try to find an easy way to break it to her, but there really isn't an easy way to tell your girlfriend that she's completely nuts. So you just let loose... and tell her about how she drives you crazy with all the little things that she does, which have gotten on your nerves more and more over the last few months. In fact, you really just can't stand to be around her anymore.

"I just can't deal with your drama anymore!" You blurt out.

Seething, your girlfriend takes a moment to compose herself, then gathers her purse and heads for the door.

"Trust me, baby... you haven't seen drama yet."

She slams the door behind her, leaving you to wonder just what she means by that.


The next day, you wake up and get ready for work, just like any other day. When you get to work, you notice everybody is staring at you.

What prompted the stares?
14.title: You just can't deal with her drama anymore!

141.content:
You brush off the strange looks of your coworkers and sit down at your desk.

Firing up your computer, you're immediately beset by a barrage of e-mails. Clicking on one of them, it opens to reveal the embarrassing picture of you at last years' holiday party. Another e-mail is an itemized invoice of all the money you've spent on "male enhancement" products in the last two years. A third e-mail lists the questionable websites you've been visiting on company time. And so on and so on...

Looking at the cc: list on the e-mail, you realize that your now ex-girlfriend has forwarded these to every single contact in your address book.

Your head sinks into your hands as you remind yourself never to cross someone who works as a computer administrator.
141.title: Something on the computer

142.content:
Moving down to your office, you find the source of your coworkers' stares. Your office has been completely ransacked. Furniture has been overturned, your books and documents shredded... epithets scrawled across the walls and carved into the desk. It looked like a gang of hoodlums had raided you office... although you knew it to be a gang of only one.

Perhaps most disturbingly, are the words that have been etched into your executive high-backed leather chair.

"This is just the beginning."
142.title: Something delivered to the office

info.brief_description: Breaking up is hard to do...
info.description:
Okay, you've finally had it. You're going to end it with your girlfriend. You two have been together for just about a year now, but things aren't quite as rosy as they once were. You want to move on to greener pastures, but first you've got to break the bad news to your lady.

Be careful, though... there are good and bad ways to handle a breakup!
